sentences.en: A: This room smells a little musty.
He had spent several hours in the library poring over those musty documents.
sentences.cn: 他一连好几个小时呆在图书馆里仔细翻阅那些发霉味的文献资料.

sentences.en: His essays can be Oxbridge musty.
sentences.cn: 他的随笔或许带有陈腐的学究气.

sentences.en: I cannot breathe in here; it's too musty.
sentences.cn: 我没法在这儿呼吸, 这儿霉味儿太大了.

sentences.en: If damp, musty buildings make you ill, mould is probably the cause.
sentences.cn: 如果潮湿发霉的建筑令你生病了，霉菌很可能是病因。

sentences.en: Suddenly the foul musty odour of the brutes struck his nostrils.
sentences.cn: 突然,他的鼻尖闻到了老鼠的霉臭味.

sentences.en: The air smelt damp and musty.
sentences.cn: 空气中有股潮湿的霉味.

sentences.en: The musty aroma of incense made her head swim.
sentences.cn: 熏香发霉的气味令她感到头晕。

sentences.en: the musty smell of old books
The room smelled musty and stale.
sentences.cn: 这个房间闻起来有股发霉的陈味儿.

sentences.en: The vacant lobby, with its musty old rugs.
sentences.cn: 空荡荡的酒店大堂, 老旧的地毯.
这儿有一些发霉的旧书.

sentences.en: There are racks of musty clothing and piles of junk.
sentences.cn: 有几架子发霉的衣物和成堆的废旧杂物。

sentences.en: There is a musty chronicle, written in tolerable Latin.
sentences.cn: 现有一本发了霉的史料, 是用很糟糕的拉丁文写的.

sentences.en: Your bank - notes had a musty odour, as if they were fast decomposing into rags again.
sentences.cn: 你的钞票带着霉臭味, 好像很快就要分解成碎纸.

words.tran_cn: 必须，一定；可以，应当；很可能
绝对必要的事物；未发酵葡萄汁

trans.tran_cn: 发霉的，陈腐的，乏味的，陈旧的
trans.tran_en: a musty room, house, or object has an unpleasant smell, because it is old and has not had any fresh air for a long time
